SEARCH
Package cz.cuni.mff.java.drawing

Class RainbowPen

java.lang.Object
cz.cuni.mff.java.drawing.Pen
cz.cuni.mff.java.drawing.RainbowPen
@AutoService(Pen.class) public class RainbowPen extends Pen
An implementation of Pen for drawing a rainbow-colored stroke.

The color of the stroke is controlled by incrementing the hue of the HSB color model as the user drags the mouse.

The pen's behavior is controlled by PenSettings, which determines the stoke width. The color setting are ignored. PenSettings must be provided using Pen.setSettings(PenSettings) before use.

This class is packaged into a Pen plugin using the AutoService annotation.

See Also:

  • Method Details

    • mousePressed

      public void mousePressed(int x, int y, BufferedImage image)
      Handles the event when the mouse is pressed.

      This method starts the drawing by rendering a point at the location where the mouse was pressed. The color is initialized as the HSB hue of 0, i.e. red.

      Overrides:
      mousePressed in class Pen
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the mouse press
      y - the y-coordinate of the mouse press
      image - the BufferedImage to be drawn on
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - when the RainbowPen is used before providing PenSettings

    • mouseDragged

      public void mouseDragged(int x, int y, BufferedImage image)
      Handles the event when the mouse is dragged.

      This method draws a line segment from the last recorded mouse position to the current mouse position. The color is determined by how far the mouse has moved from its last known position.

      Overrides:
      mouseDragged in class Pen
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the current mouse position
      y - the y-coordinate of the current mouse position
      image - the BufferedImage to be drawn on
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - when the RainbowPen is used before providing PenSettings

    • mouseReleased

      public void mouseReleased(int x, int y, BufferedImage image)
      Handles the event when the mouse is released.

      This method finishes the current drawing segment.

      Overrides:
      mouseReleased in class Pen
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the mouse release
      y - the y-coordinate of the mouse release
      image - the BufferedImage to be drawn on

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the RainbowPen to its initial state.

      This method should be called any time the pen stops being used (i.e. it is deselected), it should not be called between immediately consecutive uses.

      Overrides:
      reset in class Pen
